H0.text: Which British university was the first to throw open all degrees to women (in 1878). University of Cambridge

H1.text: Which British university was the first to throw open all degrees to women (in 1878). University of Oxford

H2.text: Which British university was the first to throw open all degrees to women (in 1878). University of Edinburgh

H3.text: Which British university was the first to throw open all degrees to women (in 1878). GBLON

A4.text: Female students were granted the right to take University of Cambridge exams beginning in the late 19th century.

A5.text: Women were not admitted to the Bachelor of Arts degree program until 1948.

A6.text: In 1920, women became eligible for admission as full members of the University of Oxford and were given the right to take degrees.
